definition: rinse, clean, or empty with a liquid, squarely or solidly, having an abundant supply of money or possessions of value, sudden reddening of the face (as from embarrassment or guilt or shame or modesty)
details:
verb
- rinse, clean, or empty with a liquid
= example: rinse, clean, or empty with a liquid
= synonyms: purge
- make level or straight
= synonyms: even, level, even out
- glow or cause to glow with warm color or light
= example: glow or cause to glow with warm color or light
- turn red, as if in embarrassment or shame
= synonyms: blush
- cause to flow or flood with or as if with water
= example: cause to flow or flood with or as if with water
- flow freely
= example: flow freely
= synonyms: wash down, flush down
- irrigate with water from a sluice
= synonyms: sluice
adverb
- squarely or solidly
= example: squarely or solidly
- in the same plane
= example: in the same plane
adjective
- having an abundant supply of money or possessions of value
= synonyms: loaded, affluent, moneyed, wealthy
- of a surface exactly even with an adjoining one, forming the same plane
noun
- sudden reddening of the face (as from embarrassment or guilt or shame or modesty)
= synonyms: blush
- a sudden rapid flow, as of water
= example: a sudden rapid flow, as of water
= synonyms: outpouring
- the swift release of a store of affective force
= synonyms: kick
- a poker hand with all 5 cards in the same suit
- a rosy color (especially in the cheeks) taken as a sign of good health
= synonyms: blush
- sudden brief sensation of heat (associated with menopause and some mental disorders)
= synonyms: hot flash
- the period of greatest prosperity or productivity
= synonyms: prime, peak, bloom, efflorescence, blossom, flower, heyday
